title: Women after World War II - trend

content.question: Which of the following was true of women in the five years following the Second World War?

choices.label: Those working outside the home demanded equality in pay and promotion opportunities.
Large numbers left their industrial jobs to make room for returning soldiers.
They contributed to a sudden decline in the birth rate by employing new family planning techniques.
Large numbers were elected to high office because of their contributions to the war effort.
Young women participated in a revolution in manners and morals that challenged the values of their parents.

content.answer: Large numbers left their industrial jobs to make room for returning soldiers.

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Identify and describe a historical context for a specific historical development or process.
